intro: Tamala pubescens, commonly known as the Andean coffee tree, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its evergreen leaves and small, fragrant white flowers. The plant produces red berries that contain seeds, which are used in traditional medicine. It thrives in humid, tropical climates and is often found in cloud forests. Its botanical features make it an important species in both ecological and medicinal contexts.
